results.title: Strong Woman
results.brief_description: Meg tells her story of heartbreak, isolation, depression and her eventual healing and rebuilding, of taking control and regaining her life. With Auslan signing and subtitles only.

results.title: Signs of understanding
results.brief_description: Kris Chapman talks about the ACMI/Vicdeaf Project, its purpose and of the six deaf/hearing impaired people chosen to take part and contribute their stories and thoughts. With Auslan signing and subtitles.

results.brief_description: A moving story of how one man’s life was completely turned inside out when he suffered a stroke resulting in a loss of hearing. With subtitles.

results.title: My journey to strength
results.brief_description: Hilda suffers from deafness and here she gives a frank account of the ups and downs in her life and the traumatic effect of losing her mum just before she turned 18. Through support and determination she has survived years of depression and finally found happiness and acceptance. With subtitles.

results.title: Culture, respect and law
results.brief_description: Collin Walker Snr, a Yorta Yorta elder, tells of mission life and living in Echuca. This story was produced in one of ACMI’s regional workshops conducted in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation and funded by VicHealth.

results.title: Wise woman
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Hannan Kuea
results.brief_description: Hannan’s grandmother was a wise woman and a great storyteller who would tell Hannan ghost stories as a young girl in Sudan. This story was produced in association with the Craig Family Centre and funded by VicHealth.

results.title: Heart of Otara
results.brief_description: Otara has the reputation as one of the most dangerous places in New Zealand. But for Sami, who now lives in Australia, Otara will always remain in his heart as home, as the land of his father and his family. Proud of his color and proud of his culture, Sami talks of his memories as a child, the good times and the bad including the tragic circumstances which eventually led to a new start and a new beginning in Australia. Music composed by Sami Laga.

results.title: The Little Frenchman
results.brief_description: Roger was a widower with no living relatives or close friends. His life experiences placed him in both world wars and post war migration. This is his story.

results.title: Training for the last run
results.brief_description: Commonwealth gold medallist Raelene Boyle faced her toughest challenge in the fight against breast cancer. ‘My breast cancer diagnosis in 1996 did see me race again. This time it was a race to survive’. Created in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop ‘Journeys with Breast Cancer’ in association with Breast Cancer Network Australia.

results.title: Moomba belonged to my grandfather
results.brief_description: Moomba belonged to my grandfather, Tom Wittingslow. Of all the shows and carnivals we did all over Australia, Moomba was the best. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Festival.
